strategy:
Pre-filter returns by joining with filtered_item (and filtered_promotion? No, returns don't have promo key). Then, instead of a regular left join, perform a two-step aggregation:
1. Aggregate sales by
what_worked: Applied dimension_cte_isolate, single_pass_aggregation: Implemented two-phase aggregation strategy: pre-filtered returns tables join with filtered items first, then aggregate sales and returns separately by (item_sk + ticket/order) keys before left joining the aggregates and rolling up to channel ID. This reduces join cardinality from billions of fact rows to millions of distinct transaction groups.
why_it_worked: Pre-filtering all dimension tables into CTEs avoids repeated full-table scans; Consolidating repeated scans into CASE aggregates reduces I/O from N scans to 1
